Class GameScreen

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.World
      GameScreen

public class GameScreen
extends greenfoot.World

This is the world for the Kara Sokoban game:

This class manages the following:

  • all information about the world and pixel sizes
  • references to the icons that are used
  • the Fonts
  • all the screen states
  • all the levels
  • the current level and number of moves
  • the highscore

      Version:
      March 2011
      Author:
      Marco Jakob

      Constructor Detail

      GameScreen

      Constructor for World.

      Method Detail

      act

      public void act()
      The act method is called by the greenfoot framework at each action step. The world's act method is called before the act method of any objects in the world.

      Delegates act to the current state.

      Overrides:
      act in class greenfoot.World

      generateASCIILevel

      public void generateASCIILevel()
      Generates a level definition from all the actors currently in the world and prints it to system out.

      Usage: Drag and Drop the Actors into the World, then call this method on the world to get the level as ASCII text.
      This level definition can then be copied into a level text file.

      getAllLevels

      public Level[] getAllLevels()
      Returns all the levels.

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Highscore> getHighscores()

      setState

      public void setState(ScreenState state)
      Sets and initializes the specified screen state. Before the new screen is initialized, all objects in the world are removed.

      Parameters:
      state - the new state of the screen

      setState

      public void setState(ScreenState state,
                     boolean clearWorld)
      Sets and initializes the specified screen state.

      Parameters:
      state - the new state of the screen
      clearWorld - if true, all objects in the world are removed before the new state is initialized.
